meanings.sent1: The sailors gathered at the shipside to unload the cargo.
meanings.sent2: The waves crashed against the shipside as the vessel sailed through the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the shipside, watching the sailors work below.
meanings.sent4: The shipside loomed large, casting a shadow over the dock.
meanings.sent5: The salty breeze from the shipside carried the scent of the ocean.

meanings.definition: Located or situated on the side of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The shipside cabins offered stunning views of the sea.
meanings.sent2: The shipside ladder provided access to the lower decks.
meanings.sent3: The shipside windows rattled in the storm, making the passengers nervous.
meanings.sent4: The shipside railing gleamed in the sunlight, guiding the way for the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The shipside cannons were ready for any potential threats on the voyage.
